Posts.Content: CLHR wrote: Going for my diagnostic mammo on 3/31.  Had abnormal (BIRAD=4) two years ago and had calcifications removed (core biopsy).  Now I have a 8 mm mass in same areas of the old calcifications and had bloody discharge after the screening mammo.  I'm assuming that biopsies are in my future after this diagnostic mammo.  The bloody discharge has raised my level of suspicion/concern.  Does anyone have a similar history and it turned out not to be malignant?  With the mass being so tiny -- I'm not so concerned about the gravity -- more so trying to mentally prepare for the daily life disruptions a diagnosis could mean!  If it is cancer, I feel confident it is early detection! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: odds it's not malignant? CLHR Moderators

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2015 05:27PM CLHR wrote: Got great news! Nothing found on diagnostic mammogram and extra films taken of nipple area plus u/s. They gave no explanation for the spontaneous bloody discharge but said everything looked good-return in one year for screening! I really never imagined this could've the outcome. Was so prepared for more waiting! God speed for all who are waiting for results--what a very difficult experience
Posts.Title: odds it's not malignant? CLHR Moderators

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2015 10:28AM CLHR wrote: Thank you so much for the replies.  To clarify -- the bloody discharge was after the screening mammogram -- not a biopsy.  I'm glad my post sounded calm -- and I think I am trying to approach this very rationally -- but I have to admit that I can't stop thinking about it.  I am so happy to have found this website -- it is a WONDERFUL resource.  Much gratitude and peace to all who are here, because obviously there is a reason that we have landed at this website!
Posts.Title: odds it's not malignant? CLHR Moderators
